intro: Swertia bifolia var. wardii, commonly known as the Ward's swertia, is a perennial herb native to the Himalayan regions of India and Nepal. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous forests. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticultural settings.
